byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein and Jeremy B. Merrill contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker makes his most explicit appeal yet to evangelical Christians at event organized by Iowa Faith and Freedom Coalition; Walker's background as son of Baptist preacher and his long involvement in church may give him significant leg up over other Republican candidates.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Walker’s lifelong church involvement may be a powerful asset as he positions himself to run for president and focuses on states dominated by evangelical voters.

headline.main: Scott Walker, a Pastor’s Son, Runs on Faith as Iowa Beckons
headline.print_headline: A Pastor’s Son Runs on Faith as Iowa Nears

snippet: Mr. Walker’s lifelong church involvement may be a powerful asset as he positions himself to run for president and focuses on states dominated by evangelical voters.
